metadata.title: CVE-2019-17010 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Under certain conditions, when checking the Resist Fingerprinting preference during device orientation checks, a race condition could have caused a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
